section.name: Professional Support
section.p: For those of you who are on a more mission critical path, where time is of essence, some of the core developers have agreed to make themselves available for expedient support services at reasonable subscription fees. These developers are the actual people who develop the DPML products like Magic, Transit and Metro.
Please note that the engagement is between you and the developer. The Digital Product Meta Library is not part of the transaction.

The QoS Level provided by the developer is subject to his/her own conditions, and the standard templates below are attempts to let the developers standardize around mutually acceptable agreements. If the developer follows the templates, the template name is quoted in the fee table above. If the developer has other terms, he/she will provide a link to those terms in the table above.

subsection.name: Supreme QoS
subsection.p: This level allows the subscriber to engage the developer at any point in time, and that the developer will attend to the issue within an hour. The developer will work on a resolution at best-effort and to the greatest extent possible without risking health.

If the developer knows that he/she will not be able to comply, he/she will contact the subscriber at least 24 hours in advance to notify of such non-availability and the reason why (for instance, travelling, meeting, illness). By default and unless otherwise negotiated, the developer is entitled to 2 such instances per month, after which 50% of the Stand-by fee will be reimbursed. If the non-availability exceed 5 days, the entire stand-by fee will be reimbursed.

subsection.name: Basic QoS
subsection.p: This level limits the subscriber to engage the developer during the developer's working hours. and that the developer will attend to the issue within 4 working hours. The developer will work on a resolution at best-effort, but may limit such effort to 8 hours per day.

If the developer knows that he/she will not be available, he/she will contact the subscriber as soon as possible at best-effort, stating reason and for how long. If the non-availability extends more than 2 working days, the stand-by fee will be reimbursed proportional to the non-availability.

subsection.name: Fees
subsection.p: The fees are set by the individual developer, and the variations are due to a number of factors, such as; geographical location, experience, demand and personal preferences. Fees are typically not negotiable, unlike the consultancy fees.
